attributes.action: Review regulations on Battery Energy Storage Systems
attributes.additional_details:
These systems have a fire risk due to thermal runaway.
The fires can be self-sustaining and may last days.
Burning Battery's release hydrogen fluoride which can cause lung damage, severe burns and death.
There is an explosion risk from this type of battery
We think we need a minimum distance from the population, strict fire laws should be mandatory and all communities should be consulted.
attributes.background: Review the regulations on Battery Energy Storage System systems, including how close they can be built to homes, schools and hospitals, and rules around safety.

departments.name: Department for Energy Security and Net Zero

other_parliamentary_business.body:
On 5 June, MPs debated Battery Energy Storage Sites & Safety Regulations, in Parliament.
This was a Backbench Business debate led by John Milne MP.
The Minister for Energy Consumers, Miatta Fahnbulleh MP, responded on behalf of the Government.
Read the transcript (https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2025-06-05/debates/69C88AD8-77F8-4F85-A934-2DA4AFCCB24B/BatteryEnergyStorageSitesSafetyRegulations)
Watch it in full (https://parliamentlive.tv/event/index/128d5ba5-4ca2-47aa-9e1e-f82675eb8f12?in=15:31:24)
Read the research briefing (https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-7621/)
Explainer
Backbench Business debates give MPs an opportunity to debate a topic of their choice, and receive a response from the Government.
They are a way to:
raise awareness of an issue
seek to influence government policy
put the views of backbench MPs, political parties, and the Government on record.
They do not generally involve a vote on a particular action or decision.
See our visual explainer (https://ukparliament.shorthandstories.com/cet-backbench-business-debates/index.html) on how these debates work.
Your UK Parliament newsletter
Sign up (https://parliament.us14.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=098af33234df9814f59fb205f&id=6e29cb1262) to a regular newsletter on the work of Parliament and how to get involved.
other_parliamentary_business.subject: Battery Energy Storage Sites & Safety Regulations: debate in Parliament
